Jason Derulo has blamed "racial discrimination" for an altercation with American Airlines crew and police at Miami International Airport on Wednesday. 
The singer was allegedly stopped from checking in nearly 20 bags onto a flight by airport staff members. 
The singer, who was flying to Los Angeles, advised staff he was a Concierge Key holder, which means he is allowed to check more baggage. 
Jason had been late to check-in to the flight so one of his entourage attempted to check the bags in on a later flight. Jason Derulo (Photo: REUTERS) 
And in a video filmed by TMZ, he claims American Airlines staff said his crew member was told he needed to fork out $6000 to check the extra baggage onto the flight. 
Jason was already on his flight at the time, and as they pulled away from the gate he insisted they turn the plane around. 7th Annual amfAR Inspiration Gala New York (Photo: WENN) Read More Jason Derulo's ex Daphne Joy flashes her curves in skimpy underwear 
He claimed the pilot demanded his removal from the plane, and police were there to meet him at the gate. 
“If I wasn’t Jason Derulo, I wouldn’t be here right now," he later told TMZ. "I’d be in cuffs. It’s 100% racial because the initial thought in people’s minds is, ‘These hoodlums are causing problems.’” Jason Derulo (Photo: FameFlynet.uk.com) 
He also posted a picture of an American Airlines staff member on Instagram, and wrote: "I spent millions on your airline throughout the past ten years between myself and my entire staff but have still experienced racial discrimination today at miami airport!!! 
"Called 15 police officers on me as if I'm a criminal! It's not ok that when you find out who I am the gears change!" 
An American Airlines source told TMZ that elite customers are allowed to check three bags, but Jason's friend tried to check 19 bags.
